samples.context: Several diseases, including cholera, tuberculosis, smallpox, and hepatitis can be prevented by vaccination.
samples.question: What diseases can be prevented by vaccination?

samples.context: A worldwide campaign against smallpox has finally led to its eradication from most parts of the world.
samples.question: What was the result of the smallpox campaign?

samples.context: These days vaccines are made on a large scale from microorganisms to protect humans and other animals from several diseases.
samples.question: How are modern vaccines produced?
